colleges.College: School of Industrial and Labor Relations
Jeb E. Brooks School of Public Policy
College of Art, Architecture, and Planning (AAP)
College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS)

social.description: The hub of the engineering population, no wonder they’re planning to install showers in the next renovation.
Where else can you sip coffee, contemplate farming, and try ten different types of seating all in one place?
Party on the bottom, business at the top.

leisure.description: Whether you’re visiting Zeus, or eating at the desks upstairs when Zeus is full, Goldwin-Smith is the place where you tell yourself you’re going to study, but end up yapping with friends instead.
The first on the list of 161 things every Cornellian should do.
A testament to Cornellians' commitment to holistic well-being!

study.description: The scholarly epicenter, featuring the infamous ‘stacks’, where Cornellians spend prelim season “immersing themselves in the pursuit of knowledge”.
Where you head over when Olin Library and Libe have no more seats! Also home to the iconic Harry Potter Library.
Hidden all the way in the ag quad, Mann may not be the easiest library to get to but it sure does have fun chairs.

eat.description: After interacting with the lovely Okenshields staff, you will never refer to this infamous dining hall as the ‘worst’ again.
A popular alternative, offering an unlimited stir fry supply.
How fast can you speed walk up the slope to get to your next lecture, with a stomach full of tacomania?
